search_parameters.q: An Assessment of Faculty Performance: Some Correlates Between Administrator, Colleague, Student and Self-Ratings Blackburn, Robert T. Clark, Mary Jo Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: An assessment of faculty performance: Some correlates between administrator, colleague, student and self-ratings
organic_results.snippet: This paper addresses the uncertainties surrounding the evaluation of faculty work performance and reviews the conflicting studies of the two principal professorial roles, teaching and research. It then presents the findings from a study of the faculty at a typical liberal arts college. The 45 full-time (85 percent of the population) faculty members were rated by administrators, faculty colleagues, students, and themselves on two performance measures:(1) teaching-effectiveness and (2) overall contribution to the college. While …
